data.title: Shooting Summary / January-February 2024
data.meta_description: Find out more about the latest projects that DPs and camera operators from around the world have been prepping, shooting and grading.
data.text:
Find out more about the latest projects that DPs and camera operators from around the world have been prepping, shooting and grading.

Header image: Aga Szeliga ACO working on feature Ferrari.

Amanda McAllister Personal Management (AMPM)

Sean Van Hales is shooting the series Inside No. 9 with directors Al Campbell, George Kane and Guillem Morales.

Berlin Associates

Edward Ames GBCT is shooting the fifth block of Waterloo Road S12 (Wall to Wall/Warner Brothers TV/BBC). Will Baldy is shooting The Sandman S2 (Warner Brothers for Netflix). Sarah Bartles Smith recently finished shooting Mr. Big Stuff (dir. Matt Lipsey; Water & Power Productions for Sky Comedy). Claudio Cadman is shooting Phoenix Rise for the BBC. Andy Clark has recently finished reshoots on The Love Rat series he already shot for Clapperboard (dir. Katherine Churcher). Nick Cox is coming to the end of shooting block four of Waterloo Road S12 with director Angela Griffin – he’ll then go on to shoot block six for Wall to Wall/Warner Brothers TV/BBC. Len Gowing recently finished on Granite Harbour for LA Production/BBC Scotland. Nick Martin recently finished shooting Douglas Is Cancelled (Hartswood Films for ITV). Trevelyan Oliver recently finished three-part comedy series Mammoth for the BBC (dir. Ben Palmer). James Swift recently finished shooting the second block of new TV series Protection (dir. Sasha Ransome; New Pictures for ITV). Alistair Upcraft is due to start prep on Whitstable Pearl S3 for Buccaneer. Matt Wicks recently finished shooting Avoidance S2 for Ranga Bee Productions. Phil Wood recently finished shooting The Bay S5 (Tall Story Pictures for ITV). Tom Pridham is prepping and about to shoot Jesus Crown of Thorns (Nutopia) in Morocco. Pete Rowe recently finished shooting Mandy S3 for the BBC. Annemarie Lean-Vercoe is covering the last couple of shoot weeks on Suspect for ITV Studios. Frank Madone recently finished shooting Channel 4’s “Night Out”, the pilot for a Buffalo Pictures series called Peaked (dir. John Addis). He’s now shooting short film Scenes From My Childhood with director Raffi Chipperfield.

Casarotto Ramsay & Associates

Julian Court BSC has returned to shoot The Diplomat S2 for Netflix with Alex Graves. His work on season one of the series has been nominated at this year’s ASC Awards. Matt Gray BSC is prepping In The Room for Binocular and Netflix. Frank Lamm is shooting Nine Perfect Strangers S2 with Nicole Kidman for Hulu, filming in Germany. Annika Summerson BSC reunites with Robbie McKillop to shoot Big Talk Studios’ Ludwig. They last collaborated on Then You Run which won Annika an RTS Craft Award last year. Tudor Vladimir Panduru RSC is shooting The President’s Cake with Hasan Hadi in Iraq.

Femi Awojide, Beatriz Delgado Mena, Ed Hubert, Gerry Vasbenter, and David Pimm are all shooting commercials. David is also reunited with Alex Lawther to shoot his latest short film.

Independent Talent

Eben Bolter BSC ASC has just finished shooting The Life of Chuck, a feature directed by Mike Lanagan and starring Tom Hiddleston and Mark Hamill. Jordan Buck is busy shooting with directors David Mellor, Felix and Tim Brown for projects including Google and Lego. Miguel Carmenes has been shooting with directors Lu Xiao Wei, Talya Galasko, Simran Lotay, Troy Roscoe and Guy Paterson. Chris Clarke has been reunited with director Adam Wells on a virtual/LED shoot, director Ben Mallaby and photographer Jason Schmidt for Chanel, and director Rosie Gaunt Mathieson. Oliver Curtis BSC is shooting The Road Trip with China Moo Young. Ben Davis BSC is completing Ilya Naishuller’s Heads of State. Michael Filocamo is currently prepping on Tom Vaughan’s I, Jack White, which will start shooting early 2024.

Kit Fraser is reuniting with Craig Roberts for The Scurry. Sam Goldie is grading The Gathering for World Productions/Channel 4 with director Amanda Blue. Catherine Goldschmidt BSC has gone to Vancouver to shoot the second season of The Last of Us. Suzie Lavelle BSC ISC has been shooting commercials with Mollie Burdett at Spindle Films. Seamus McGarvey ASC BSC ISC has reunited with Gavin O’Connor for the sequel to The Accountant. Bani Mendy is grading Death in Paradise S13 (dir. Steve Brett). Andreas Neo has been shooting commercials with Final Pixel and Banquet Films. Mark Patten BSC is shooting the lead block of Black Doves with Alex Gabassi. James Rhodes has been busy shooting live sessions with RAYE, (dir. Paul Dugdale) and Brent Faiyaz (dir. Chris Howe) with SiFi Films. Most recently James has returned from Italy where he was shooting for Unicredit with Billy Boyd Cape. George Richmond BSC has just wrapped Deadpool 3.

Chris Ross BSC is shooting Brian Kirk’s The Fisherwoman. Ashley Rowe BSC is shooting Flight 103 with Otto Bathurst. Martin Ruhe ASC is finishing off The Amateur. David Ungaro AFC is working with regular collaborator Scott Frank on Department Q. Tom Wade is shooting out on location across many UK locations with regular director Ben Stevenson. Mark Waters has finished shooting blocks two and three of Grantchester S9 directed by Katherine Churcher. Erik Wilson BSC has been busy with director Michael Gracey shooting for Lindt on location in Uruguay and in South Africa shooting for Jakafi. In between that he reunited with Lucy Forbes in London on Starling Bank. Mark Wolf is currently shooting in Cornwall on Playing Nice directed by Kate Hewitt. Maja Zamodja BSC has just finished shooting Bad Sisters S2.

Intrinsic

In features, Bebe Dierken has been grading Midas Man.

In TV drama, David Liddell has been continuing to light the “Blue Unit” on Band of Spies in Hungary and Malta. Gabi Norland has also been operating on Insomnia. Tom Hines still shoots Beyond Paradise. Andrew Johnson has been back at Casualty. James Mather ISC has been in the Canaries shooting Stags. Nic Lawson has been grading Vigil. Bebe Dierken continues in Germany on the Iraq War drama The Second Attack, and John Hoare takes on a bit of Hollyoaks.

Simon Hawken FNF, Gabi Norland, Martin Roach, Lynda Hall, and Leon Brehony have all been busy with commercials, trailers, idents and corporate films.

Lisa Richards Creatives

Paddy Jordan ISC is currently grading on S2 of Signora Volpe in Italy, directed by Declan Recks and starring Emilia Fox (Route 24/ Cattleya for Acorn TV). JJ Rolfe ISC is currently shooting on new TV series The Hardacres, working with directors Rachel Carey and Kieron J. Walsh (Playground Entertainment in assoc. with Red Berry Productions and Newgrange Pictures for Channel 5).

Loop Talent

Matt North‘s recent short film The One Note Man has been shortlisted at the Academy Awards and the BAFTAs. Iikka Salminen‘s feature film Sebastian headed to the Sundance Film Festival. Ali Asad has recently wrapped a feature in Wales. Lorenzo Levrini is prepping a feature film. Dave Miller has recently wrapped a film with Stigma Films. Denson Baker ACS NZCS is shooting a feature in Asia. Martyna Knitter is shooting a feature. Chris Fergusson is in post on a BBC series.

Natalja Safronova is in prep for a documentary. Tom Watts is shooting a documentary for Netflix.

Jerry Amadi-Pradon recently shot the Arsenal x Adidas campaign ‘No More Red’ with director Olivia Rose for Homeground. Chris O’Driscoll, Jon Muschamp, Aman Sahota, Nick Bennett, Olly Wiggins, Paul Mackay, Emma Dalesman, Chris Fergusson, and Tom Turley are working in short form. Bertrand Rocourt has been working in commercials across Europe. Kyle Macfadzean is shooting short form in the Middle East. Matt Gillan has been shooting music promos.

Camera/Steadicam operator Ben Eeley ACO joins the Loop Talent Crew Diary Service. Ben recently wrapped as the B-camera/Steadicam operator on Mr. Big Stuff. James Anderson ACO is wrapping on Sweetpea as A-camera/Steadicam operator. Jack Smith and Alice Sephton have been operating on short form projects. Sebastien Joly ACO, Grant Sandy-Phillips, Laura Seears, Michael Vega and Gary Kent have been operating Steadicam on commercial projects. A huge congratulations to Michael Eshun-Mensah ACO, who has been accepted by the ACO as a full member.

Llewellyn Associates

Robert Shacklady recently shot a campaign for BMW’s XM range, using the Alexa Mini LF with a DZO Vespid Prime set and a CATTA Zoom set.

Lux Artists

Christopher Aoun has been shooting All That’s Left of you directed by Cherien Dabis. Kasper Tuxen started shooting Ali Abbasi’sThe Apprentice. Nicholas Bolduc CSC has wrapped shooting The Count of Monte Cristo directed by Matthiew Delaporte and Alexandre Patelliere. Pat Golan has shot a B&Q commercial directed by Elliott Power. Adam Newport-Berra has lensed Omar Apollo Promo with directing duo rubberband. Henry Braham BSC is still shooting Superman: Legacy directed by James Gunn. Arnaud Potier AFC has shot a Mini commercial directed by Daniel Wolfe. Bobby Shore CSC lensed a Diesel commercial with a director Matt Lambert. Rob Hardy ASC BSC has shot an NDA project directed by Henry Scholfield. Eigil Bryld DFF wrapped Martin Campbell’s feature Cleaner. James Laxton ASC has lensed a Gatorade commercial directed by Noam Murro. Diego Garcia has shot an AT&T commercial with director Daniel Wolfe.

Harry Wheeler has lensed an NDA project directed by Sam Brown, an Asics commercial with a director Frank Lebon and an UEFA commercial directed by Molly Manning Walker. Manuel Albero Claro DFF wrapped shooting Submergée with director Alante Kavaite. Olan Collardy has shot Surviving Earth with director Thea Gajic. Shawn Peters shot a Beats commercial directed by Bradford Young ASC. Ben Fordesman started shooting The Thing with Feathers directed by Dylan Southern, and lensed a Boots commercial with a director Sam Brown. Benjamin Loeb FNF has shot a Meta commercial with a director Fredrik Bond. Monika Lenczewska PSC wrapped lensing Tomas Alfredsson’s series Faithless and shot a Ford commercial directed by Jonas Lindstroem. Justin Brown has shot a Carlsberg commercial with a director Sam Pilling. Julien Poupard AFC shot Les Regales de l’Art with a director Dominique Baumard. Jonathan Ricquebourg AFC started shooting Lucile Hadzihalilovic’s La tour de glace. Arseni Khachaturan has shot a Samsung commercial directed by Frederik Bond.

McKinney Macartney

Ben Butler has been shooting commercials. Sergio Delgado is shooting Surface S2 for Apple TV+. Gavin Finney BSC is filming the second series of Wolf Hall for the BBC, with Peter Kosminsky directing. Dale Elena McCready BSC NZCS is shooting Day of the Jackal for Sky Studios. Alessandra Scherillo has been shooting commercials. Sam McCurdy ASC BSC is prepping Firebug for Apple TV+. Richard Stoddard is shooting Buried for Amazon Prime.

Plan B

Gina Ferrer has been nominated for Best Cinematography at the Spanish Film Academy’s Goya Awards and at the Gaudí Awards of the Catalan Film Academy for her photography of the multi-awarded feature film 20,000 Species of Bees. Historia de Pastores, shot by Àlvar Riu Dolz, will debut at IFFR 2024 in the Bright Future Section. Beatriz Sastre is shooting the feature film Mala Influencia, directed by Chloé Wallace and produced by Nadie Es Perfecto & N&L Films. Josep M Civit is shooting the TV series Hotel Cocaine in the Dominican Republic, directed by Guillermo Navarro. Nilo Zimmermann is shooting the feature film Las Madres No, directed by Mar Coll and produced by Elástica & Escándalo Films.

PrinceStone

Simon Baker Assoc. BSC ACO, camera and Steadicam operator, has finished shooting Polite Society, a feature film with Claire Foy and Richard E. Grant (dir. Peter Glanz, DP Adriano Goldman ASC BSC ABC). Cosmo Campbell ACO, camera and Steadicam operator, has finished shooting as A-camera operator and Steadicam on the Amazon pilot of Charlie Bone (dir. Toby Macdonald, DP David Pimm). Michael Carstensen ACO, camera and Steadicam operator, is shooting Gangs of London S3 (dir. Hong Sun Kim, DP Callan Green ACS NZCS). DP Thomas English is shooting commercials; his recent campaigns have included Sky Sports Women’s Soccer League for director Nathan Tettey with Knucklehead and Xbox Alpine with director Ben Newbury for Common People. Rob Hart ACO, camera and Steadicam operator, has just finished filming as A-camera and Steadicam operator on The Jetty, a thriller with Jenna Coleman (dir. Marialy Rivas, DP Ben Wheeler BSC). Tony Kay ACO, camera and Steadicam operator, will be prepping for the new series of Strike as A-camera operator/Steadicam (dir. Sue Tully, DP Pedro Cardillo ABC).

James Layton Assoc. BSC ACO, camera and Steadicam operator is currently shooting Black Doves as A-camera operator/Steadicam on the Sister Pictures/Netflix contemporary drama (dir. Alex Gabassi, DP Mark Patten BSC). Dan Nightingale ACO, camera and Steadicam operator, has started prep on the live action feature of How To Train Your Dragon (dir. Dean DeBlois, DP Bill Pope ASC), shooting in Belfast. Joe Russell ACO, camera and Steadicam operator, is shooting S2 of Silo as A-camera operator and Steadicam with DPs Baz Irvine BSC ISC, Kate Reid BSC and Ollie Downey BSC, shooting at Apple Studios. DP Diego Rodriguez is currently shooting a documentary in Mexico for Astronaut Films with showrunner Gavin Whitehead. Fabrizio Sciarra SOC Assoc. BSC GBCT ACO, camera and Steadicam operator, has been shooting as camera operator and Steadicam operator on Interview with a Vampire S2 in Prague for DP David Tattersall BSC.

Sara Putt Associates

Giulio Biccari is lighting block two of Black Doves for Sister pictures and Netflix. Aga Szeliga ACO (pictured in article header) has just returned to working on Venom 3, which paused this year due to the strikes. Last year she spent time on location in Italy working on the Ferrari movie, out now. Al Rae ACO worked on HBO series The Regime (AKA The Palace) staring Kate Winslet. The series was directed by Stephen Frears and will be released next year. Andrei Austin ACO worked on Joan for Snowed In this year. He is currently in prep on Lena Dunham’s Too Much. Andrew Bainbridge ACO has just finished shooting on Sherwood S2. Prior to this he worked with DP Vanessa Whyte on the Noel Fielding comedy series coming soon to Apple TV+. Last year he worked on Netflix series One Day which will air in 2024. Chris Maxwell Assoc. ACO worked with Mick Coulter this year on feature film A Scottish Love Scheme. Prior to this he operated B-cam on Nightsleeper for Euston Films, which will air on BBC One early in 2024. He operated A-cam on STVs Screw and Buccaneer’s Crime with DP David Liddell. Dan Evans ACO worked in Cornwall and Bristol on hit children’s show Malory Towers. Danny Bishop ACO spent the first half of 2023 working on The Acolyte for Lucasfilm, which we look forward to watching on Disney+ this year. Danny is currently working on Above the Below with Idris Elba starring. Ed Clark ACO is currently working on one of the new Black Mirror episodes. Last year he worked with Nanu Segal on Scoop and operated A-camera/Steadicam on feature film Your Christmas or Mine 2, released in December 2023.

George Amos has been working on the Untitled Guy Ritchie project on location in the Canaries. The trailer has just dropped for Masters of the Air and will air on Apple TV+ in January 2024. Ilana Garrard ACO spent a few months this year working on location in Croatia on O’Dessa with Rina Yang BSC. She also worked on The Decameron which will be released on Netflix next year. James Frater ACO worked on The Gorge earlier this year for Apple TV+, the release date is still to be announced. James Leigh ACO is currently working on Road Trip for Paramount+. The Lazarus Project S2 has been released this week on Sky One. James’ recent work has also included Michael Sheen’s directorial debut on The Way which will air on BBC One next year. Julian Morson ACO is currently shooting on a Marvel film. Last year he worked on Wicked Little Letters which we look forward to seeing early this year. Heads of State was put on hiatus due to the strikes and is due to start up again soon.

Rick Woollard ACO has most recently been booked to operate Steadicam dailies on Riz Ahmed’s Hamlet. He operates AR and Steadicam dailies on HETV and films such as Scrapper, Mary & George, Unicorns and Alex Garland’s Men. Recently he operated Steadicam on a Bose shoot with Little Simz and The Chemical Brothers (‘Live Again’). With Louis Vuitton this year, he shot on the tarmac at Charles de Gaulle airport with Lionel Messi and from the top of the Arc de Triomphe, having shut down the Champs-Élysées. Tanya Marar ACO worked on The Decameron which will land on Netflix this year. Tom Walden ACO worked on The Ballad of Renegade Nell which will be released on Disney+ this year. Tom wrapped last summer on The Tattooist of Auschwitz for Sky and is now prepping for The Gold S2. Vince McGahon ACO operated A-camera/Steadicam on all episodes of Slow Horses, available to watch on Apple TV+. Will Lyte ACO worked on four episodes of Mary and George, starring Julianne Moore, which will be released early next year. He’s just wrapped on Paris has Fallen for Urban Myth Films; prior to this he operated A-camera/Steadicam on Two Brothers’ Boat Story for BBC One. Zoe Goodwin-Stuart ACO worked on The Burning Girls, currently available on Paramount+, and Wonka, out now. Zoe is currently working dailies on Above the Below and Black Mirror.

Screen Talent Agency

Mike Staniforth has been working with director Rosie May Bird Smith on a number of commercial projects for Biscuit, as well as shooting Rosie’s debut narrative film with Slick Films.

United Agents

Remi Adefarasin OBE BSC is shooting Mr. Loverman for BBC Studios/Fable Pictures directed by Hong Khaou. Søren Bay DFF has just finished shooting on The Rig S2 for Wild Mercury Productions, for Amazon Prime. Mark Nutkins is grading Rivals with Happy Prince for Disney.

Danny Cohen BSC is prepping series four of Slow Horses. Damian Paul Daniel is filming various shorts and documentary Fearless currently doing the rounds on the festival circuit. Martin Fuhrer BSC is meeting for various projects. David Higgs BSC has concluded work on Five First Dates and has begun prep Department Q. Matt Lewis is grading on Steve Knight’s A Thousand Blows for Disney Plus. Kieran McGuigan BSC is meeting for various projects. Laurie Rose BSC is shooting Day of the Jackal in Hungary. Bet Rourich AEC has recently been nominated for a Spanish Goya Award for her work on Un Amor. John Sorapure has wrapped on the third instalment of the Paddington franchise. Simon Tindall is grading the opening block of the second series of Sherwood.

Ollie Downey BSC is shooting two episodes of Silo for Apple TV+/AMC. Laurens De Geyter SBC is shooting the Flemish fiction series Dead End, directed by Jakob Verbruggen and Maarten Moerkerke. David Rom is grading the opening block of Amazon’s The Devil’s Hour S2 and is prepping for The Devil’s Hour S3. Álvaro Gutiérrez AEC is currently reading scripts for his next project. Sam Heasman will begin prep for Lazarus in February with director Nicole Volavka.

Si Bell BSC is lighting series Miss Austen with director Aisling Walsh for Bonnie Productions/BBC Studios. Sam Chiplin is shooting Justin Kurzel’s next series The Narrow Road to the Deep North in Australia. Charlotte Bruus Christensen ASC is shooting commercials while reading and meeting. James Friend ASC BSC has just finished lighting Above the Below, a feature produced by Future Artists Entertainment with directors Idris Elba and Martin Owen, and is shooting commercials. Anton Mertens SBC is prepping series Bookish, written by and starring Mark Gatiss. Milos Moore has just finished lighting multiple blocks of series one and two of A Thousand Blows for Disney+ with directors Ashley Walters and Dionne Edwards. Neus Ollé AEC BSC is reading and meeting. David Raedeker BSC is prepping Butterfly, a feature produced by Quiddity Films with director Itonje Guttormsen. Kate Reid BSC is lighting block three of Silo S2 for Apple TV+ with director Bert. Ed Rutherford will start shooting Mandrake soon with director Lewis Arnold for ITV. Juan Sarmiento G. is lighting mini-series Helicopter Heist (B-Reel Films for Netflix), with director Daniel Espinosa. Anna Valdez Hanks has begun prep on the first block of Missing You with director Sean Spencer for Quay Street Productions. Ben Wheeler BSC will begin prep in February with director Jeremy Lovering on The Undertow, a series by Complete Fiction for Netflix, having just finished lighting The Jetty, with director Marialy Rivas, a series by Firebird Pictures for BBC One.

Barry Ackroyd BSC has been busy with commercials, including a new spot with Tom Hooper c/o Smuggler. Magni Ágústsson has recently shot feature film One For the Money for director James Griffiths. Alex Barber has recently shot a Philadelphia spot with directors Humans c/o Riff Raff, London and has been in New York and South Africa for a new spot with directors The Sacred Egg. Philipp Blaubach is currently shooting The Diplomats for Netflix. Daniel Bronks has recently shot a Disco spot for director Clay Weiner at Biscuit, as well as a Heineken spot for Karien Cherry c/o Outsider, London. Simon Chaudoir has recently shot a Helena Rubinstein spot for Justin Ridler c/o Birth as well as a Mercedes V-Class commercial with directors Zhang & Knight c/o Akkurat. Sara Deane is currently shooting TV series The Wives in Malta. Lasse Frank has just wrapped on a Hennessey commercial for director Andreas Nilsson c/o Biscuit in Georgia. He has also shot a Netflix commercial for director Adam Hashemi in Budapest c/o Czar. Nick Gillespie has just wrapped on Ben Wheatley’s latest feature Generation Z.

Steven Keith Roach has been busy with commercials, including an Amazon spot with Dom & Nic c/o Outsider and has most recently collaborated with Danny Kleinman on a Direct Line spot c/o Rattling Stick. Tim Maurice Jones has just wrapped on upcoming feature Speak No Evil for director James Watkins. Erik Messerschmidt ASC has recently been shooting in Tokyo with director Ian Pons Jewel for a new Amazon spot. Diana Olifirova has just wrapped on We Are Lady Parts Series 2 for Working Title. Tristan Oliver BSC has been busy shooting a new Just Eat spot for The Bobbsey Twins with Arts & Sciences in London. James Oldham has recently shot a new film with collaborator Paul Holbrook in Manchester. Simon Richards has recently shot a Santander commercial for director Guy Manwaring c/o Merman. Chris Sabogal has recently shot a new Quickbooks spot for director Tiny Bullet c/o Flipt in London. Simona Susnea has just wrapped on Heartstopper S3 for director Andy Newbery. Laust Trier Mørk has just wrapped The Responder S2 for BBC One. Haris Zambarloukos BSC has now wrapped on Beetlejuice 2 with director Tim Burton.

UTA

Ed Wild BSC‘s most recent films have been The Covenant and The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warefare, both with Guy Ritchie.

Vision Artists

Anna MacDonald had two short films nominated for the short film BIFA. Anna’s short film The Talent, starring Emma D’Arcy and directed by Thomas May Bailey, was also shortlisted for the Iris Prize, as well as Festival of Slaps directed by Abdou Cisse – with the latter taking home the prize. James Blann has wrapped shooting the new series of BBC Comedy Peacock (dir. Joe Roberts through Big Talk). Luciana Riso has wrapped Adeyemi Michael’s documentary feature Hidden Heroes. The feature film focusses on the black soldiers that fought in World War 2 and is produced by October Films, with Maiya Rose on A-camera for the drama leg of the documentary. Nick Morris continues to shoot Sweetpea with See-Saw Films. Directed by Ella Jones, the series is based on the ‘serial killer with a twist’ book from C.J. Kuse. Benedict Spence BSC is currently grading new Netflix series Eric with Benedict Cumberbatch. The series is produced by Sister Pictures and directed by Ben’s long-term collaborator Lucy Forbes. Jack Wilkinson has been shooting the new series of The Responder, starring Martin Freeman and directed by Charlotte Regan.

Jonas Mortensen recently wrapped Chris O’Dowd’s new TV series Small Town Big Story. The Irish set comedy drama is written by O’Dowd and Jonas’ episodes are directed by Catherine Morshead. As well as this, Jonas recently started shooting the new Fudge Park series Daddy Issues, starring Aimee Lou Wood and directed by Damon Beesley. Kia Fern Little continues to shoot the Apple TV+ documentary of a high-profile music star (dir. Luke Monaghan). As well as this, this month also saw the premiere of Kia’s work on new BBC series Such Brave Girls (distributed by A24). Will Hanke has wrapped new TV comedy We Might Regret This for Roughcut, directed by Nick Collett. As well as this, Will has begun prep on a feature film written by Colin Trevorrow and starring Orlando Bloom. Courtney Bennett has been shooting development reels for a new feature-length music doc for director Matt Kay. Eoin McLoughlin’s short film Two for the Road won best short and best cinematography at Galway Film Festival, directed by Locky McKenna and produced by Screen Ireland. Rhys Warren has been part of a longform documentary for Britpop band Blur (dir. Simon Lane).

In commercials, Arthur Loveday has been shooting content for Alexander McQueen. Ian Murray has been lighting promos for the NSPCC. James Watson has been working with with regular collaborator Ben Tonge for Prodigious. Jim Jolliffe has been working with David Edwards at MythSmyth. Moritz Moessinger has been lighting gin commercials for Mert Alas with January Productions. Luke Scott reteamed with advertising partners Hogarth to shoot content for Soap and Glory. Martin Hill continues to shoot with Simon Ratigan at Rogue. Tim Fok has been lensing home brand commercials with Simon Willows. Stephen Dunn has been lighting Samsung content with Family Creative. Tim Green has been lighting tech and food with photographer Dan Tobin Smith, and finally Spike Morris has been lensing commercials for Racket Studios and Agile.

Worldwide Production Agency

Simon Archer BSC begins prep on the new series Ludwig with director Jill Robertson for BBC. Pedro Cardillo ABC begins prep on C.B Strike: The Ink Black Heart with director Sue Tully for BBC. Anna Patarakina FSF begins prep on the upcoming feature Dreamers with director Joy Gharoro-Akpojotor for Quiddity Films. Ed Moore BSC starts principal photography on the upcoming feature My Fault with director duo Similar But Different for 42. Baz Irvine BSC ISC continues principal photography on series 2 of Silo with director Michael Dinner for Apple TV+. Lorenzo Senatore ASC AIC continues 2nd unit on Venom 3 with director Kelly Marcel for Marvel Entertainment. Catherine Derry continues principal photography on the new series The Road Trip with director Stella Corradi for Paramount+. Nathalie Pitters continues principal photography on series 2 of Funny Woman with director Oliver Parker for Sky. Joel Devlin BSC continues principal photography on series 2 of Showtrial with director Julia Ford for ITV. Callan Green ACS NZCS continues principal photography on series 3 of Gangs of London with director Kim Hong Sun for Sky.

Jack Edwards shoots pickups on the upcoming feature film La Boheme with director Robin Norton-Hale for Finite Films. Stephen Murphy BSC ISC wraps principal photography on the final episodes of Say Nothing with director Micheal Lennox for FX. Ruairí O’Brien BSC ISC wraps principal photography on the new series Small Town, Big Story with writer/director Chris O’Dowd for Playground Entertainment and Sky. Tony Slater Ling BSC wraps principal photography on series 2 of Bad Sisters with director Dearbhla Walsh for Apple TV+. Richard Donnelly ISC wraps principal photography on the new series Dune: The Sisterhood with director Richard J. Lewis for HBO Max. Bryan Gavigan wraps principal photography on the new series Ruth with director Lee Haven Jones for ITVx. Robert Binnall wraps principal photography on the upcoming feature film The Morrigan with director Colum Eastwood for Cowboy Cosmonaut Films. Jake Gabbay shot in Belgrade with directors Furmaan & Vass and OB42 for the latest Thorpe Park commercial. Jake also wrapped on the new Marshall campaign with Dog Eat Dog and director Kevin Castanheira.
